What is a differential microphone? It's two microphones, one closer to the speaker than the other. Sounds from close by are picked up louder by the closer microphone than the other. Sounds from some distance away are picked up equally by both microphones. With a little bit of electronics, you can mute distant sounds while allowing close ones to come through crystal clear.
